content: We need an artwork on the ground floor of every new building
We need residential buildings with integrated bike stands
We must encourage the construction of eco-friendly housing
We must bring life to newly built neighbourhoods by integrating premises nearby for retail, public services, etc.
We must provide more premises for shared public services, such as nursing homes
We must integrate more connected services
We must develop new systems for noise reduction in cities (eg. green walls)
We must provide shared vegetable gardens in jointly owned buildings, on rooftops, etc.
We must create more spaces and opportunities for exchange between inhabitants via urban planning
We must create tax incentives for the thermal renovation of buildings
We must raise awareness of and promote building trades
We must demolish all low-rise and tower blocks in residential areas (is this OK?- I could not find the translation)
We must invest in energy-related innovation to enable every city to produce its own electricity
We must revive the construction sector
We must simplify the rules of urban planning, alleviating the weight of planning requirements and procedures
We must end limitations on building height in order to boost the density of cities and limit urban sprawl
We must make better use of underground spaces and rooftops to gain more usable space
We must consider food self-sufficiency for cities by reintroducing urban farming and sites for producing food
We must improve the way we adapt public spaces and buildings for disabled people
We must develop new ways of keeping cities cleaner
